required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preconception Lifestyle Interventions to Improve Future Metabolic Health (Before the Beginning)
clinical_study.official_title: Before the Beginning: Preconception Lifestyle Interventions to Improve Future Metabolic Health

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to investigate whether the combination of high intensity exercise and time restricted eating before and during pregnancy can reduce the risk of hyperglycaemia during pregnancy.

detailed_description.textblock: Women who are planning a pregnancy will be recruited into a parallel groups randomised controlled trial where the intervention will consist of high intensity training and time-restricted eating. The intervention will continue throughout pregnancy. The investigators will assess whether this lifestyle intervention can effect maternal and offspring cardiometabolic health.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Gestational week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Total body - and trunk adipose tissue in the new-born
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 72 h of birth and after 6 weeks post delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Subcutaneous adipose tissue thickness will be measured at 15 body sites using a validated optical device (Lipometer, EU Pat.NR. 0516251).

secondary_outcome.description: Ultrasound echocardiography Blood flow and myocardial function will be measured using mechanical wave imaging (MWI).

intervention.description: Participants will be asked to limit the time-window for their daily energy intake to a maximum of 10 hours.
Participants will be encouraged to exercise with high intensity 2-3 times per week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- contemplating pregnancy within the next six months
- At least one of the following criteria: BMI â¥ 25 < 40 kg/m2, gestational diabetes in a previous pregnancy, previous infant > 4.5 kg, fasting plasma glucose > 5.3 mmol/L, or Non-European ethnicity
Exclusion Criteria:
- On-going pregnancy
- Trying to conceive â¥ 6 cycles at study entry
- Known diabetes (type 1 or 2)
- Shift work that includes night shifts > 2 days per week
- Previous hyperemesis
- Known cardiovascular diseases
- High intensity exercise â¥ 2 hours/week the last 3 months
- Habitual eating window â¤ 12 hours
